sentence.idiomatic: The movie is about to start. Let's go in.
Will you be here soon?
Is he going to get married soon or not?
She plans to have a baby next year.
I heard that she gave birth to a girl.
When is your wife due?
You need a hammer.
Give me a pair of scissors.
Is that umbrella yours?
You've got it wrong. He's not the person you're looking for.
I'm sorry, I got the time wrong, so I arrived late.
You get such a simple question wrong, do you not have a brain, or what?
So are you able to fix the computer or what?
I really want to know--what does he look like?
So are you going tomorrow, or not?
What things do we need to bring for the barbecue?
I forgot to bring my wallet.
Did you bring your umbrella?
Doctor, my wife is about to give birth!
Don't worry, don't worry. I'll go have a look. Hey, hand me a screwdriver.
Screwdriver? You want a Phillips-head or a flat-head?
Whatever, just hurry! Hmm, do you have a hammer?
Yes.
Also, find me a saw.
Oh... here.
Hmm, that's no good. This is tiring me out. Do you have an electric drill?
Have you lost it? What do you think you're doing?
Uhhh... I forgot the key to my medical kit.
